question: Which of the following is not a feature of the Hydrocarbon Exploration and Licensing Policy (HELP)?
option1: Uniform licensing system to cover all hydrocarbons such as oil, gas, coal bed methane etc.
option2: Unform rates for Offshore and Onshore blocks
option4: Allows E&P Activity on all Hydrocarbons
answer: Unform rates for Offshore and Onshore blocks
explanation:
The New Exploration Licensing Policy (NELP) was based under the profit sharing methodology, which makes it necessary for the Government to scrutinize cost details of private participants and this led to many delays and disputes. Under the new regime of the Hydrocarbon Exploration and Licensing Policy (HELP), the Government will not be concerned with the cost incurred and will receive a share of the gross revenue from the sale of oil, gas etc.

A comparison of both the policies – HELP and NELP is given below:
Parameter HELP NELP
Fiscal Model Revenue sharing Profit sharing
Cost recovery Not applicable Yes
Cost efficiency Encouraged Neutral
Royalty Low rates for offshore Standard rates
Exploration Period Onland and Shallow Water- 8 years
Deepwater- 10 years		 Onland and Shallow Water- 7 years
Deepwater & Ultra-deepwater - 8 years
Management Committee More focus on  reservoir monitoring; 
no micro-management		 Technical & financials
